content.description: Beautiful, steep crack climbing. Crux is at the boulder problem start.
content.protection: Good gear all the way up. But the crux is at the bouldery start. A very powerful move to hang on while protecting the opening moves, or have your belayer spot you until you can get a rest and easier gear placement in at about fifteen feet.
content.location: The obvious crack line running straight up the center of the cliffs.

content.description: Excellent edges and jugs with reachy moves at times between them. I recommend using just a carabiner on the first bolt due to the crux being between bolt 1 and 2. 5.10- climbing above this. If you do it let me know what you think for a grade. My guess is 10+
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. Cordelette equalized w single non-locker at anchor added 8/22/2020.

content.description: Around the corner, left of First Kiss, the striking twin crack system on the arete. The first few moves at the base of the climb are much more difficult (hard 5.10) than the rest of the crack climbing above. The alternative, 'Padawan' start, coming in from the left and gaining the cracks above the hard boulder-problem start, makes for a more uniformly difficult and enjoyable 5.8 climb. All gear, plenty of it, with a double bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Main wall, around the arete, left of First Kiss. Obvious twin crack system.

content.description: Look for a left facing corner and climb the thinner finger crack inside the corner to a ledge and then up to another ledge and bolt to a crux move to the anchors
Steep crack - fingers to hands to fist, with edges on the face to use.
content.protection: Excellent gear placements all the way up, but steep and strenuous climbing. Double bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Facing the wall, it's the obvious crack on the far right end.

content.description: Follows the shallow groove, straight up the center crack system on the diamond shaped face. Two bolts, good crack pro, and double bolt anchor at the top. Awesome exposure and view of the Carrabbasett Valley, on the climb and from the top.
content.protection: Trad, with two bolts and a double bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: This climb is located in the high, or 'Wrong Ravine'. The southernmost of the three ravines that make up the Main Wall area of the cirque. The climb follows the crack system that's visible on the left side of the photo, just before the pines block the view.

content.description: The crux is about 3/4 to the top with a tough mantle. A good classic crack to off width climb with a few secrets.
content.protection: Double anchor at the top with rappel rings and webbing strap on a tree above the climb for setting a top rope. Wide gear for trad it will take at least 2 big boys and some medium friends for the middle of the climb with a nice hand crack at the top.

content.description: First sport route in the Cirque. Located on the main wall (middle ravine), left (south) of Welcome to the Cirque. Five bolts and a double bolt anchor at the top. Steep, like the rest of the routes on the main wall, with not-obvious sequences that would make it a tough on-sight. Good fun.
content.protection: Five bolts on the route, and double bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: On the main wall, left of Welcome to the Cirque. Easily located, as it the only sport climb on the wall, so far.

pathTokens: Cirque on Little Bigelow mountain, The

content.description: This wall is located just below the Appalachian Trail, on the eastern end of the cirque.
